website_summaries.verdict: Though the applicator could be better, you won't find a crabgrass killer that delivers better results. The reasonable price and guarantee add to its appeal.
pros: A no-mix formula that works fast
begins working in as little as 3 hrs
Manufacturer offers a purchase price refund guarantee if you aren't happy with results
cons: Some owners voice complaints of it malfunctioning, breaking, or never working
Some tough weeds may require an extra dose

customer_reviews.title: LIQUID DEATH
customer_reviews.text: Kills the crap outta crap. I'm reviewing this from the wife's account (I'm sure she'll appreciate it). She hates Roundup because it's some toxic-ace shiat (incidentally, that's why I love it - I need something that kills plant life to death). This kills plant life to death in a 5-star kind of way - I can spray an area and never have to trim there for the rest of the summer. Year-long liquid weed-trimmer goodness. P.S. I, too, hate Roundup "because Monsanto" but whattayagonnado? It works, I buys, part of my soul dies.
customer_reviews.author: AMAZONIAN

customer_reviews.title: I honestly don't understand what is not to like about this
customer_reviews.text: Says it will kill stuff...stuff died. Said it was ready to use...I took it out of the box and used it...I honestly don't understand what is not to like about this. You know...if you want something that will keep stuff and is ready to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Kills everything!
customer_reviews.text: Kills everything! I use it on my fence line so I don't have to weed eat all the time. My backyard is a half acre and one of these jugs goes down one side of my fencing (just to give you an idea of how much you need).
customer_reviews.author: Jillian

customer_reviews.title: Takes a few days to really kick in, but works wonders
customer_reviews.text: This thing kills whatever plant you spray it on. I've used it on grass, weeds, and even a small bush with amazing results. I've found it works fastest when you spray it on when it's a hot dry day, but I've put it on shortly before an unexpected rain and it still manages to kill. Be warned though -- it works REALLY well. I've had splatter hit nearby a flower and that thing wilted dead within a day. Also, if it gets on any part of your lawn and you don't put some grass seeds down soon after, be prepared to see weeds popping up in that barren area soon enough.
customer_reviews.author: M. Patel

customer_reviews.title: Better options out there?
customer_reviews.text: Took 2+ days to kill what I had sprayed. Weeds were growing again 2 weeks later. The cheap stuff I got from Lowe's worked just as good for half the price...
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Dobson

customer_reviews.title: Kills everything
customer_reviews.text: Picture tells it all. The original size of the weeds/crabgrass was twice the width it was in the before picture. All easily removed since it was dead all the way through.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Collins

customer_reviews.title: Works fast and well.
customer_reviews.text: I have a huge area of pavers in South Florida and if I don’t stay on top the weeds, the pavers lift and it gets costly. I use this once a week where I spot new green weeds popping up and it keeps my work minimal and my eyes don’t hurt every time I step outside from seeing “future weed work.”
customer_reviews.author: Marissa McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to Use
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers have commented, the wand system needs to be addressed by manufacturer. The pressure is not enough to generate a strong spray. The wand often stops functioning entirely. You can never use all the product as the wand stops working long before the liquid in the container is finished. Then you're left having to decide what to do with the rest of the Roundup. Last year, I was so frustrated that I opened the top and just started pouring it directly on the weeds! The chemical does work to kill the weeds. My review is for the container.
customer_reviews.author: Donnachaidh

customer_reviews.title: You have to use A LOT for it to work! Plus it's a CARCINOGEN!
customer_reviews.text: You have to spray and spray an awful lot of each weed to kill it, and it takes 3-days before the weeds die. Plus I saw a commercial on TV for a lawyer Class Action Suit against Roundup AFTER I already used it all around my house stating that Roundup has caused MANY cases of cancer in users of this exact product!!! I don't grow any vegetables or anything I eat in my yard, sop maybe I'm lucky. I'm pretty sure the people getting cancer are those who spray near plants that grow things that you eat. BE CAREFUL WHAT YOU BUY!
customer_reviews.author: J. Mccay

customer_reviews.title: Well, in the bottle, indeed sloshes a GREAT PRODUCT that works. HOWEVER, the power wand......
customer_reviews.text: GREAT PRICE AND PRODUCT.However, despite convenience of the power wand, it is simply unreliable. Stops..starts..sputters..foams..sprays.I love the idea but, unfortunately, back to the pump version...
customer_reviews.author: Perry

customer_reviews.title: Would give a zero if I could
customer_reviews.text: I've used this 3 times on the same basic weeds in a gravel driveway. The last time it was 75 degrees and sunny, with no rain coming. Not a single weed has been affected by the roundup. The last time they were soaked in it. Very disappointed and disgusted that I spent $ on this (wanted another brand that had worked before, but was out of stock!) If it had been effective, 5 stars to the design of the sprayer for safety ad accuracy. No I have to figure out how to dump the rest of it responsibly. Grrrrr
customer_reviews.author: Amazon woman

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy...The pressure spraying system fails
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to do some spring grass control at my north woods cabin. The first time I used it, I pressured the sprayer and started spraying. the pressure seal around the top of the container failed within 3-4 minutes making it impossible to use. I will not have to transfer the liquid into a different sprayer to use it. I can not return it because the jug now leaks.
customer_reviews.author: BWH

customer_reviews.title: Poor Sprayer
customer_reviews.text: Roundup is a good product, but why would they incorporate such a cheap sprayer. The sprayer is terrible. The only way to use the product is to put it into another sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Burnham

customer_reviews.title: LEAKY MESS
customer_reviews.text: Ordered Apr 24, supposed to arrive May 6 but held up until late in the day on May 7. Received and what do you know? LEAKY MESS. Thankfully they had plastic around the container but the directions were saturated and unreadable. Totally ridiculous. No sprayer, no directions nothing on YOUTUBE for this 'trigger' style. I call Roundup and there is a 25 minute wait time. I've wasted all afternoon on this simple little project ... I regret ordering this product and would like a refund of my TIME AND MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: Savage

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Did not work at all other than it made the weeds look sluggish and the lived again, next day weeds are up and smiling at me for failing to kill them . I actually licked the product and it seems that it has more water in it than chemicals. Something tells me that ammonia from a dollar store would work better;( I want my money back so I can buy ammonia or bleach from a dollar store to use for same purpose!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. 66666

customer_reviews.title: Why did they try to fix what wasn’t broken? ...
customer_reviews.text: Why did they try to fix what wasn’t broken? This new versions spray wand is awful. They tried to extend it but all that did was make the spray come out lighter. Ended up pouring into my portable sprayer and using with a pump spray handle.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Harris

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of junk. The pump up pressure doesn't last long before your pumping it again. Also the product itself doesn't work well either. I have sprayed the same grass growing between pavers on my patio 3 times and they have not died back, still green at the base. Round Up must have changed their formula after the lawsuit.
customer_reviews.author: Dug

customer_reviews.title: The nozzle never works.
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying this item for years, both in-store and online. Nozzle worked without a problem. However, the last two I've had to buy the nozzle just doesn't work. The first time it stopped after the first use, this time it didn't work at all. It's not worth returning either. The brand is great, it kills weeds. It's a shame they decided to go cheap with the nozzle.
customer_reviews.author: DLL

customer_reviews.title: A Broken Wand...Bummer
customer_reviews.text: When I received this product I was super excited to kill some fricking weeds! I put on my protective gear and Pulled out the poison. Suddenly I came to realization that the wand was broken. There was a cut in the wand. Normally It would be a blessing, but i was actually really disappointed when I realized the product can’t be used.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Adams

customer_reviews.title: THEY DON’T SPRAY
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2. The first one wouldn’t spray at all. But instead of returning it, I thought I would just use the other one and when that was empty, pour the first into the second. The second one sprayed as I used it 2 different times but just for a few spot treatments. Went to use it again the other day, as many weeds have really popped up now and the 2nd one DOESN’T SPRAY NOW. I have 2 virtually full containers that don’t spray. I get the feeling these were “seconds”. Will never order this sort of thing on line again as it’s not easy to return and I no longer have the box. Extremely dissatisfied!!!
customer_reviews.author: dreamshop

customer_reviews.title: Product Old?
customer_reviews.text: I believe this was old product or had frozen -- as it was gunked up inside and would not go through the "automatic sprayer." This has only happened to us before when we've kept product over the winter. It will not work as well in the spring. We had to pour it out into a different sprayer container. That was a pain -- especially as we already paid for the "sprayer" part of it.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Rocha Rated: 4 out of 5
customer_reviews.text: I had many weeds because of all the recent rainy days in AZ. I would suggest that you spray this product directly to the the bottom of the weeds, where the weed and the ground meet. Also, spray it when the sun is out. This way the product is absorbed and kills the weed faster because of the heat from the sun. Don’t spray it at night or during a cloudy days. Spray it during a sunny AM day. You may need to spray additional stubborn weeds that refuse to leave the following AM morning.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: I was really disappointed with the poor quality of the sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I was really disappointed with the poor quality of the sprayer. It was hard to get it to disperse nicely, and this resulted in having to twist the nozzle around to try to get it to work. Doing so got Round-Up all over my hands. The pressure is also lackluster. It seems to self deflate if you pump it too hard. All said I'd just buy a decent sprayer and get the regular Round-Up refill. This is wacky and cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Solar Monkey

customer_reviews.title: Is the product supposed to clog during every use?
customer_reviews.text: Have now bought two separate containers with the battery-operated applicator and both of them have had spray nozzle problems. After the first one almost clogged completely I figured I’d try a second one in case it was just my product. Nope: A second one wouldn’t spray without taking four times longer than it really should to do the job. Spray, tap the nozzle, pray, come back five minutes later and repeat. My advice is to buy a separate electric sprayer; it’s an investment in your sanity.
customer_reviews.author: James W. Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Works but nozzle doesnt spray right
customer_reviews.text: Now it's easy to set up, connect hose and use nozzle. That's easy. Pumping was easy. The issue was this just Barley covered the weeds directly close to my home. Then I was OUT. I have a doublewide so it's not big yet the whole bottle was used just for that couldnt do my driveway or concrete area nothing. THEN the nozzle just dribbled it out it did NOT spray properly. Otherwise it seems to be working where I was able to get done at. Guess another bottle or 2 for rest I need to do and PLEASE FIX SPRAY NOZZLE PPL!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Very dangerous chemicals, don’t use this!
customer_reviews.text: I would never buy or use this product again. It is highly dangerous and very bad for your health as it is a seriously carcinogenic. Wish I knew what to do with the almost full jug I purchased last spring. Look up the current litigation against this product.
customer_reviews.author: Linda O

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself a favor and save your money!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely dreadful, followed the directions and guess what the weeds are still alive and I'm out of the money that was spent on this useless and extremely disappointing product. I would have better results using Distilled white vinegar and dawn than I have using this poor excuse of a weed killer. I don't enjoy leaving terrible reviews but don't want people to make the same mistake I did. Reading all the positive reviews had me think its going to be gold but not at all unless I received a water down product it is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfie30

customer_reviews.title: Works just not as well as before
customer_reviews.text: It's only been 3 days but so far nothing looks different. Nothing is wilted or anything. Last time I used roundup, within a couple of hours you could see plants looking sad. Now they just look like they got a nice bath. Hopefully in a week or so it will show some improvement and I will update accordingly. todays date aug31 date sprayed was aug 28. Update it is now 9/4/19 and the grass is dying quite nicely but the weeds are still thriving. I reckon I can safely recommend it for grass killing but it's a no go on the weeds. Well eventually it did make the weeds look a bit less green so that's something.
customer_reviews.author: Ram

customer_reviews.title: The product does not work and the spray system does not hold up..
customer_reviews.text: The first 5 minutes of use, the nozzle broke from the wand, then the adjustment spray turn dial - the notch broke. The biggest disappointment is that it did not kill the small weeds that grow in between the patio bricks and in the gravel driveway. Why is it battery operated when just my old pump bottle has worked for years? So disappointed that Roundup would even put out a product that is inferior. Jan
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: It Works, its Roundup
customer_reviews.text: Have not use Roundup in years due to all the negative publicity but had a large job of kill-to-the-roots grass situation. In the description, you might see results in 3 hours. Did not see any for 24 hours at least where the Roundup I used in the past was within the hour. The desired results are there after a week, good enough. Good or bad, the sprayer shoots a pencil lead sized stream instead of a spray, not ideal for grass patches. Did a grid pattern and it seem to do the job. The pump system works but does not hold pressure. Have to hand pump continuously, will switch to a different sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: RJMHRT

customer_reviews.title: Defective Sprayer and not battery operated!
customer_reviews.text: The sprayer was defective and did not work. First it was caught up inside the handle which I was able to pry loose with difficulty and then it did not spray anyway. It was advertised as battery operated but it is just a trigger. I have had trouble with the battery operated ones in the past as well where the sprayer stopped before the container was empty and not way to replace the batteries. The product works well on weeds if you can get the stuff out.
customer_reviews.author: Active Lady

customer_reviews.title: Sprayer Fails
customer_reviews.text: Everyone knows Roundup works. I sprayed the weeds on my walkway. They turned the weeds brown overnight but it was hard to pull them out by the roots. My complaint is the sprayer worked exactly once. My neighbor bought this and his sprayer worked only twice. I call BS on that. I had to pour it into a spray bottle. Not cool. So, 5 stars for product and 1 star for packaging gave this 3 stars. Much cheaper at local store.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really bad directions, ineffective product.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would do the trick for the testy weeds around the drive way, but hasn't don't it quite yet. So, here's one of the problems, it doesn't really tell you, once it's assembled that the end nozzle needs to be, slightly removed before it will spray well. If you don't do that very critical step, it will just dribble and you look like an idiot walking around in your yard dribbling weed killer. Also, it doesn't really say how to remove pressure, another thing that's really important. All that aside, it hasn't killed my weeds yet, I'm gonna keep trying, maybe update the review then, but it's not my favorite for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Nico S. Montanari

customer_reviews.title: Kills everything!
customer_reviews.text: I tried "Spectracide" and other inferior products and the weeds were laughing at me. If they can grow in my back yard in Las Vegas in 120 degree weather with direct sunlight and no water, guess what? They are some pretty tough sons of B's! If you want to kill these guys, you have to get Roundup. I know there is a lot of bad publicity around this product, but use your head and wear a mask and rubber gloves. Then spray it directly onto the weed, don't use a crop duster. It works!
customer_reviews.author: Finn Markmanrud

customer_reviews.title: Kills the weeds
customer_reviews.text: Takes 1-2 weeks to work. Leaves you wondering for a long time then the Weeds die off.
customer_reviews.author: PAT

customer_reviews.title: The wand is awful
customer_reviews.text: Pump sprayer was so much better. What a waste of time trying to get this thing to spray.
customer_reviews.author: Red Badge

customer_reviews.title: Highly effective for unwanted stubborn weeds!
customer_reviews.text: Highly effective. Not that practical to use to be honest. It would be easier if you had an option for somehow keep the pulverization continuous which as far as I understood wasn't possible. Nonetheless, the product works amazing. I used it to kill weeds in the sidewalk and in a couple of days everything was dry! Impressive. Just had to grab them and throw away.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Parreira

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: I love RoundUp. It reliable kills broadleaf weeds and I have LOTS of those. I am disabled so the convenience of having this (sorta) heavy gallon jug of weed killer delivered to my door is wonderful. Now, if only it would work in the rain, it would be perfect (I live in rainy Seattle). But no complaints at all - it works like magic and I will order it again & again.
customer_reviews.author: RubyCat

customer_reviews.title: Kinda works?
customer_reviews.text: I had to spray my weeds twice (2 or 3 days apart). It says you'll get visible results within 3 hours. I sprayed the first time & nothing happened to my weeds. So a few days later I did a second application. I REALLY drenched them this time. Seems to have worked better, mostly dead weeds now. So I guess you should just know, you have to DRENCH the weeds pretty good. I thought I sprayed enough the first time. We'll see how long the weeds stay dead & gone.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica VazquezTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Quick shipping
customer_reviews.text: I do not get it to spray as long as it says it does between pumps even though I pump it up quite a bit I prefer the battery operated wand my first spraying only succeeded with about 50% being killed so I'm gone with a second spraying a little thicker all the trees that was growing died instantly basically but the weeds are taking a licking and still growing
customer_reviews.author: Sherri1728

customer_reviews.title: IT KILLS WEEDS DEAD> D.E.A.D.
customer_reviews.text: It does what its supposed to do... and exactly what I want it to do. KILL WEEDS. Really kill anything that I spray with it. It does just that. Those weeds die quickly and stay dead. I dont have to worry about anything popping up again in that area because Roundup is the equivalent of the scorched earth policy. P.S. I hope I dont get cancer from this stuff. Just kidding Monsanto's lawyers... but seriously if I do get non-hodgekins lymphoma I will see you lawyers in court. The ambulance chaser lawyer tv commercials have informed me. Just kidding! or am I? I dont know.
customer_reviews.author: Bàká Hään

customer_reviews.title: Wand is a pleasant surprise - no hand pumping
customer_reviews.text: I have used roundup for decades and usually I use concentrated 40 or 50% and dilute it in a sprayer. I didn't have access to my sprayer and needed to spray some bermuda grass. I was expecting to have the typical hand cramps from manually spraying when the package arrived. Cheaper than home depot and it had a battery powered wand! Battery included. Now don't expect sprayer quality but just to spray out a third of the bottle and only push a button, I could afford to go back over it because my hand was having squeeze cramps. Unless I report back otherwise, assume Roundup still kills bermuda grass unless this grass is magic grass (My Cousin Vinny homage).
customer_reviews.author: Roger Moore

customer_reviews.title: Weaksauce
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if this has been reformulated following the lawsuits, but man, I remember the old Roundup. It was brutally effective. This, not so much. I bought it to use in my rock garden and beds, and with the exception of plain grass, it doesn't seem all that effective at all - especially on broadleaf "hardier" weeds. It's fine on the weaker plants, nut I was candidly hoping for much more.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Barton

customer_reviews.title: Great product/ Bad nozzle
customer_reviews.text: The product itself worked really well for weeds, but as other reviewers have said the wand is pretty horrible. It worked at first, then it stopped and kind of leaked, so I adjusted the front nozzle area (you can twist to adjust the nozzle) and it worked for awhile again. On my third time using, it completely stopped working at the end of the spray session. So it doesn't look like I'll be able to use it next time. The nozzle is still stuck as I'm writing this review and adjusting the tip no longer works. Too bad since I really like the product itself.
customer_reviews.author: happiestplace

customer_reviews.title: wished better from roundup
customer_reviews.text: First of all, the formula works. That's not my problem. The problem with this hunk of junk is the actual jug and spray handle. It barely sprays at all. It has no distance whatsoever. It does not have a wide spray to cover more than a single leaf at a time. Worst of all, I'd wager half of the formula drips out onto my hand. I really don't like getting roundup all over my hands. I almost asked for a refund because of this flaw, but instead, I just started wearing nitrile gloves while spraying. I shouldnt have to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Applicator is terrible!
customer_reviews.text: Roundup Product itself is great. I absolutely HATE the applicator. It's battery powered, or motorized or something. It's awful, it works about 40% of the time. The rest of the time, I'm trying to apply the product, it just buzzes and whirs, and doesn't do anything. So my time spent actually applying this prodcut has doubled. I wish I had kept my last container of Roundup that had a non-motorized applicator. Unfortunately I had already thrown it away. At this rate, honestly, I might just put the roundup in a spray bottle. I'd probably be better off.
customer_reviews.author: Glen M. Yoshida

customer_reviews.title: Works well in AR
customer_reviews.text: Likes: 🤘 Kills everything 🤘 Easy to spray 🤘 Easy to operate Dislikes: 👎🏼 Could work faster but that might make it less safe 👎🏼 I Don't feel safe using it due to children or animals that might get into it 👎🏼 Explore and make natural options too as a big co. take risks to increase your business
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian2005

customer_reviews.title: Does what it supposed to
customer_reviews.text: Love round up. Does the job of weeding pretty quick. For some reason this batch is leaving white residue on my rocks. Not something I’ve experienced in the past with this product. I did shake it up before using it...will try that again before using it next time. Killed the weeds right where I wanted. Was happy to have it mailed to my door.
customer_reviews.author: Daisygirl

customer_reviews.title: It kills vegetation dead
customer_reviews.text: I needed to clear out a bunch of weeds in empty flowerbeds, including some poison ivy. This did the trick - everything was dead in a couple days. Don't spray when expecting rain.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: No complaints.
customer_reviews.text: As a handicapped person it was wonderful to be able to order this large size and have it delivered to my door. The price was good, too. I have used Roundup for as long as I can remember and always have had excellent success with it for killing weeds and grass. After reading the negative comments, I'd like to say to those folks that this product does not work immediately. It usually takes about 4-5 days before the plant turns brown and dies. It takes time for the poison to absorb through the leaves and work its way down the plant to the roots.
customer_reviews.author: Creaky

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to get rid of ... "kill" ... the weeds, crabgrass, however it isn't working. I have spayed the area 3 times and it wilts the weeds, but they keep growing!
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: Poor Application device, poor overall results.
customer_reviews.text: The product did NOT effectively kill ALL the grass / foliage. I applied it 3 times over a 6 week period, raked out the the dead thatch between applications. The "Battery Operated Pump" mechanism was very weak. I installed NEW Duracell Batteries, it did not help. The stream of liquid from the nozzle was so slow, it would take 3 minutes to cover a 2 sq ft area. Buyer Beware....
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Stokes

customer_reviews.title: It pretty much kills everything it touches
customer_reviews.text: Multiple times I've tried the Round Up concentrates, but they never work as good as the premixed weed killer even if I mix them stronger than the directions say. Spray a weed in the morning with this stuff and you can visibly see it's dying by afternoon if not sooner. You have to be careful if there is any type of breeze because the slightest over spray will damage or kill stuff you want to keep. If you want something dead then this is the weed killer you need.
customer_reviews.author: West Texas

customer_reviews.title: Works great and a good value
customer_reviews.text: Roundup works well, we already know that so the real benefit here is the air pressure based sprayer instead of something battery operated or manual and the price which is great for what you get. I would definitely buy this again but all I need now is refills. The sprayer is also great for bug killer which I like to spray on my foundation and around the doors and windows in the spring and again mid summer.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Defective container  cannot return because of liquid  seeping out
customer_reviews.text: Cannot return item because it’s hazardous material and defective container. Have been using this product in the same type container for over 25 years. This must’ve been returned before because the mechanism to hold the pressure does not work and the nozzle is also broken, cannot package because cannot keep the liquid inside. Wondered why it was so cheap now I know. Cannot get refund without returning the item which I can’t It is best to buy this at a local store so you can return
customer_reviews.author: Diamond

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: You would think after buying several Round Up products that have the hand sprayer battery powered or like the one I just bought, which is suppose to work by working the handle as a pump. Well, round up has a perfect record on their products not being able to be utilized. Total junk. So I put all the liquis into a regular $1.00 spray bottle and I am using the weed killer in that manner. However, I still got stunk paying for something that does not work, but I guess that is my fault thinking Round Up makes product containers that work.
customer_reviews.author: PLT

customer_reviews.title: Roundup did not work as it claimed of killing weeds in my landscape area.
customer_reviews.text: Roundup weed killer did not work at all on spraying even after several days. Totally dissatisfied as it did not work as claimed. I can not go out to return this product due to recent restrictions and I am on high risk due to my physical health. So I am stuck with useless container of round up. I have used very old weed killer of another company but it still worked as it claimed. Roundup is from very established product but I am totally dissatisfied. Don’t buy and waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Ashna  Zaheer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of junk. Difficult to set up. White tip fell off the nozzle. Liquid leaking all over my hands. Liquid dripping all over the gravel and plants I don't want to spray. Save your money buy something else. I won't order this again. If it was easy to return I would return it. Unfortunately I'm stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Maryann Kaczmarek

customer_reviews.title: Great product wouldnt use anything else
customer_reviews.text: My all time favorite weed killer. Kills weeds in just a couple hours and keeps them from coming back for days to weeks. has a key ingredient that cuts off flow from the roots killing the weed entirely. I have yet to find another big brand that has the same ingredient. I use this around the garden and flower bed. with the fancy nozzle the sprayer has prevents you from hittin your wanted plants.
customer_reviews.author: Chessmaster

customer_reviews.title: good chemical lousy sprayer
customer_reviews.text: The sprayer is terrible. I've used it on several occasions and the sprayer has not dispensed the product properly . It would foam up in the middle of use then spray nothing at all and when changing from one spray pattern to another it would stop dispensing product
customer_reviews.author: Pharmer D

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage. The sprayer didn't work. I could hear that it was on, but nothing came out. It was also leaking from the bottom. I couldn't tell exactly where it was coming from but it got all over my driveway even though nothing came out of the sprayer. I threw it out since it is trash, so I won't be able to get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: PFC

customer_reviews.title: Kills weeds. Wand is useless.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff flat kills weeds. No question there. Wand is useless. Barely sputtered anything out and then stopped altogether. Cleaned it out and gave it another go. Same thing happened. So poured into into a garden sprayer. Also, just noticed I could have bought this for less at local building supply store. Oh, well. The convenience of delivery was worth a few bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: It's strong stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this was a lot stronger than I thought. It killed the weeds in my backyard within a few hours. I also wanted to get rid of some shrubs and used a good amount on them. It took a little longer but after a few weeks, my shrubs are completely dead. Now, I can easily trim the branches and remove them. Woo! I was pleasantly surprised how well it worked and how easy it was to use. With 20 pumps, I got a good steady stream for 2-3 minutes. So, I definitely recommend spending a little extra and get the motorized pump version. The extra effort needed to pump it up is a waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: heysharynne

customer_reviews.title: The product is excellent but . . . . . .
customer_reviews.text: The container developed a slow leak. The shelf became saturated before I noticed. I set it in a large container while I found something that did not leak. Had it been in a closed cupboard I would not have noticed and it would have leaked away completely. I believe the container was flawed from the start so more could be sold after the first one leaked away. Can't prove it but this is one method of making capitalism work.
customer_reviews.author: L. Evatt

customer_reviews.title: If dead grass/weeds is what you want, this works
customer_reviews.text: It killed the weeds and grass. Not gonna lie though, attaching the sprayer etc was a little tricky to figure out and there are no directions for it.
customer_reviews.author: Lea H

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: We recently moved and have a huge hill of weeds to tackle. Nothing was working on this disaster. But, this stuff works! Finally these weeds are dying. It takes a lot to kill a little (at least in my case), but the nozzle and sprayer allows you to spray things from a distance. You get better at it as you go, and learn tricks to angle the sprayer and gain even more distance. I’m going to continue to use and keep it handy.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: "comfort wand" = ease, safety of use
customer_reviews.text: The product is the same and the "comfort wand" is much easier and safer to use than the slightly less expensive nozzle only option. The "wand" is an extension plus a nozzle, so the chemical is sprayed close to the ground and triggered at hand height. This means that it is much less likely that the chemical will be applied in the wrong place, or drip onto gloves etc. There are three different on/off switches for storage.
customer_reviews.author: grateful shopper

customer_reviews.title: Wands are unreliable
customer_reviews.text: The weed killer part is stars, but the wands are continually failing. Ideally i would like to buy one of these with the wand and buy refill spray in concentrate. I can easily mix it myself. However, I have had 3 of this now because the wands stop functioning. Batteries are not the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Mike R. Skiles

customer_reviews.title: Burns everything.. Worked for me..
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered pump and go.. Came with easy instructions.. Very easy to follow instructions and spray working very well.. No problem with that.. Sprayed and waited few hours and results noticeable.. Within few days everything is started burning and even big crabgrass I have spot sprayed died.. I still have to manually remove dead grass and weed but it was easy to do that after it was dead..
customer_reviews.author: prashant

customer_reviews.title: Product ok...shipping, not so much!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a 1.25 gallon jug of Roundup, and a couple other items. They tossed everything in one box with no packing material, and while it didn't hurt the jug, I also ordered a photocell controller for a light, and a couple of plastic receptacles. Needless to say, the jug smashed the sensor box, but the sensor appears to be ok. We'll see when I install it ! A little more care in packing is needed sometimes!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Miller

customer_reviews.title: Weed Killer Good. Sprayer Bad.
customer_reviews.text: The weed killer part works OK but the sprayer is horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Duffer.Top Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Roundup 5003810 Weed & Grass Killer
customer_reviews.text: This product Roundup is good for those weeds you hate to pull like check weeds and of course any weeds as well as grass. Be careful when the weather brings in wind when you are spraying. I use former Roundup btl that is smaller and use a funnel inserted in this smaller bottle to obtain the weed/grass spray from this big container. I have heard that a bottle of Round up is good in storage for one year.
customer_reviews.author: Peachie

customer_reviews.title: Order more than you think you need.
customer_reviews.text: It works great on the weeds, takes a bit more on the grass. I have rocks over a weed barrier, that does absolutely nothing to prevent the growth of weeds or grass. It’s a really small area, but I ran out of this before I was done, and only about half the weeds/grass have been killed. It takes quite a bit more than I expected and it’s annoying to have to pump it to charge it. But it does work fast 🤷🏻‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: ThatOneChick

customer_reviews.title: Pump failed
customer_reviews.text: The manual pump seemed like a good idea, however it failed. No matter how much pressure I pumped it just wouldn't move fluid. I wasn't about to take it apart and clean it! Ended up transferring the roundup to an old pressure sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: Arpy

customer_reviews.title: Product sprayer failed which is important to an 80-year old
customer_reviews.text: This product failed the 2nd use. Pump makes noise but does not dispense bug spray. I spent wasted minutes to make it work but no luck. This product is defective because I have bought & used several just like it. Upsetting to say the least now that we are in a bug rich time in Central Florida. Since the product in not useable, I find no value for my money. I missed the return by date because I was out of town. But I wanted to warn others about the mechanics of the sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: James D. Ratliff

customer_reviews.title: Pump failure
customer_reviews.text: I followed assembly instructions explicitly and verified on/off valve on container lid was on and activated batteries and set wand switch to on. Pump would not pump. Used a pump from another container and that pump worked just fine. Tested new pump in a bucket of water and it just would not pump. I do not want to return roundup liquid as it’s hazardous fluid. What I need is a new pump only
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Terrible purchase
customer_reviews.text: I should have just went to Home Depot or somewhere and bought it. The squirter does not work at all. You have to pump and pump two or three minutes just to get a little squirt. I'm just going to go buy a generic bottle to dump it in so I can use it. Had I not already used some of it I would have returned this junk bottle. The applicator does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Serious stuff
customer_reviews.text: Definitely will be getting more of this. I just got one bottle and it works. It's killed every weed I spray it on. The first time I used it though I didn't realize it was gonna rain so I think it might have washed some of it away and some weeds grew back. Second time I sprayed I made sure it wasn't gonna rain and they died. So folks if your gonna use it make sure it don't rain soon after. Just a suggestion.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Tough weeds go down without a fight
customer_reviews.text: My first sprayer on the RoundUp jug was not working so I requested it returned. No Problems there. Except I decided to just buy another jug. I have a good size yard. After using up all the second jug I switched the want to the first jug and am now catching spots I missed before. Love this product, it’s ease of use and it’s effectiveness. You’ll be pleased with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Shelleyk50

customer_reviews.title: How do you get it unclogged?
customer_reviews.text: When I got out my Roundup from last summer, it would not spray. So , no problem, I'll order another one. There is nothing wrong with the product itself - but after I used about 1/4 of it the first time out, It won't spray anymore. The battery part of the sprayer is working, and I checked all 3 places to turn it on - the cap, the lock, and the nozzle. Now I'm going to have to buy a sprayer...
customer_reviews.author: Dbjcs

customer_reviews.title: Sprayer doesn't work  worth a diddly
customer_reviews.text: The battery operated sprayer doesn't work...all settings came out in spurts or sputters....Not happy! and why is this product banned in Australia and Europe because it could be a carcinogen and not banned in the U.S?
customer_reviews.author: Suzi K

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, you will be very happy
customer_reviews.text: This product actually works, I love the way you can Spey only one little weed without disturbing a plant next to it. The only product that works, bought few different brand did not work at all, it was was absolute waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Shirin Happ

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this trigger sprayer.
customer_reviews.text: I did use the product - and it worked as it should - but this trigger sprayer is absolutely useless. I ended up having to pour the contents of this container into smaller spray bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Dan K.

customer_reviews.title: Horribly sprayer and doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: The sprayer was ridiculous hard to use and it only sprayed a tiny stream took me forever to do a tiny spot of the yard. Also it’s been over a week and it’s still alive and growing just turned some weeds slightly yellow but did not kill off anything, worth the money to go buy ground kill and use that instead!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Product for Killing Weeds
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff! I could not get the wand with the little "protective" cup on the end at any of my local stores. Really does a number on the weeds, and the little cup helps "aim" the spray. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: H. Bashinski

customer_reviews.title: Sprayer unreliable
customer_reviews.text: The sprayer just stopped working half way through the job. I had to run to Ace hardware to get a sprayer and poured the round up into it. Super frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: SMHC

customer_reviews.title: Yay!! Windy days no longer a problem!
customer_reviews.text: I've read stuff about people being upset on how this comes out. Well, for me, it came out in a little tiny stream and drops but so what? It still got all over the plant, still stayed inside the cone, still didn't give me fatigue from triggering the whole thing and I have a 180 linear foot garden!! Weed garden until this product. It might take multiple applications but it does work. I will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Pony girl

customer_reviews.title: Buy local and not on Amazon. This is a watered down version.
customer_reviews.text: The little tiny stream that this produces didn’t even kill the few strands of grass between the bricks. I soaked the areas fully yesterday afternoon and this morning NONE of the areas even look phased. I should’ve just bought this at Home Depot. I know Roundup is a good product but I’m wondering if I recurved a watered down version through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Branden

customer_reviews.title: same problems as previous round up purchases - pumps dont work
customer_reviews.text: my previous round up purchase had electric spray pump, it died and got a replacement that also did not work. now I got the gallon pump sprayer and now it will not hold pressure. These problems all happen at about the one year point. Lets see if I can get a replacement pump container. Gotta up your game in your sprayer systems, Roundup. Why so amateurish?
customer_reviews.author: Eliot

customer_reviews.title: Round up
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t really work.. ended up still having to pull the weeds by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: GREAT WEED CONTROL
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use with the trigger sprayer; can spray or stream product. Excellent control for English ivy, that my neighbor grows on his side of property fence. If it weren't for Roundup, the ivy would grow over and destroy my fence. Just be careful using product; don't breathe spray and eash hands thoroughly after use because glycosate is suspected of being carcinogenic.
customer_reviews.author: windoworld

customer_reviews.title: Works quickly, lasts a while
customer_reviews.text: I had some *very* thick weeds in part of my yard that just refused to stay away, and soaking them with this a few times has more or less eradicated them. It's also done well at killing weeds between driveway cracks, and has saved some of my larger plants that were being overrun with weeds and clover. It's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Hardman

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for years but the one purchased this year is worthless. The sprayer does Not work, it makes the usual noises but no spray. Lots of weeds in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: ccinlv

customer_reviews.title: Pump bottle broke after one use
customer_reviews.text: While the chemical works well, the pump bottle is not good. After one use something in the cap broke while relieving the pressure for storage and now it won’t hold pressure / spray at all.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley E. Voortman

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't sure at first...
customer_reviews.text: I got this and sprayed the perimeter of my backyard where the weeds like to grow at the fenceline. I saw nothing for the first couple of days, then all of a sudden I looked out the window one day and EVERYTHING was brown and dead everywhere I had sprayed! This will definitely be my go-to weed killer from now on!
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Jones

customer_reviews.title: Useless. Followed instructions to the letter
customer_reviews.text: Useless. Followed instructions to the letter. Pumped over 100 times and barely a trickle comes out. Checked for line obstructions. Defective pump. Will not build pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Did Not kill anything
customer_reviews.text: This stuff sucks. I followed the directions and my weeds did not disappear. Maybe I have some crazy hybrid weed killing resistant plants? I tried some areas of grass that I needed to be rid of. It worked in a couple spots but for the most part it did not.
customer_reviews.author: The Regime

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I just started ordering more and more from Amazon and I am very pleased with shipping. Amazon has sent everything quickly and quality is not hampered. In my front yard I have 6 shrubs so this helps me out in small ways so I don't have to till the ground up every time. I don't mulch, so this helps me out some. I need to apply weed prevention after this. None of this is 100% perfect. We always have to do the work.
customer_reviews.author: GOSHOPNOW

customer_reviews.title: Works slowly to kill weeds. Spray stream is narrow and thin.
customer_reviews.text: I used this product on weeds in my backyard. 24 hours later some weeds still looked healthy. Other weeds looked like they were in the process of dying. The pump is easy to setup and use if you carefully follow directions. However, the stream that comes out is narrow and slow like an old man with a prostate condition.
customer_reviews.author: Barry E.

customer_reviews.title: Did not receive hose, wand or motor.
customer_reviews.text: This came in today and all I got was the jug of roundup. None of the attachments were included. Apparently, my only option is to return and replace, which is stupid. I just need the attachments.
customer_reviews.author: JML

product_meta.title: Roundup Ready-To-Use Weed & Grass Killer III with Comfort Wand, 1.1 gal.
product_meta.description: Style:Small Wand| Pattern Name:Grass KillerKill the toughest weeds and grasses down to the root with Roundup Ready-To-Use Weed & Grass Killer III with Comfort Wand! The formula is ideal for use in and around vegetable gardens, flower beds, tree rings, and mulched beds, as well as on cracks in driveways, walkways, and patios. Plus, the extendable Comfort Wand provides a continuous spray for more accuracy without having to bend over. This convenient, no-mix formula is rainproof in just ten minutes—AND you get visible results in 3 hours. Kill weeds faster with Roundup.
feature_bullets: Kills the toughest weeds and grasses to the root. Guaranteed! (Consumer Guarantee: If for any reason you are not satisfied after using this product, simply send us original proof of purchase and we will replace the product or refund the purchase price.)
Use in and around vegetable gardens, flower beds, tree rings and mulched beds, as well as on cracks in driveways, walkways and patios

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars5,792 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
